bioghist.p: Philip Powell Calvert (1871-1961) was a professor of entomology at the University of Pennsylvania (1907-1939). He served on the council of the American Entomological Society for nearly 60 years, serving as its president (1900-1915), vice president (1894-1898), and corresponding secretary (1895). He was the associate editor and then editor of Entomological News (1893-1943). Calvert was a recognized authority on Odonata.

scopecontent.p: This is a collection of papers by Philip P. Calvert, entitled "Odonata Shorter Papers 1890-1903." The volume includes several miscellaneous inserted items, including illustrations, and obituaries of A.D. Smith and W.L. Abbot, both of whom collected specimens studied by Calvert.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.

acqinfo.p: Provenance: Donated by Mrs. Amelia Calvert.
